questions.question_text: How does PRINCE2 ensure that the specific management needs of an organization are met?

discussion.content: I also think A is correct
selected A, Mod please clean up these PAID questions!

Selected Answer: A
PRINCE2 ensures that the specific management needs of an organization are met by:

A. By incorporating tailoring

Tailoring in PRINCE2:
Definition: Tailoring refers to adapting the PRINCE2 methodology to suit the specific needs, context, and environment of a particular organization or project.
Purpose: Tailoring allows PRINCE2 to be flexible and applicable to a wide range of projects, regardless of size, complexity, industry, or organizational culture.
Implementation: Organizations can adjust the PRINCE2 processes, themes, and terminology to fit their specific circumstances and project requirements. This ensures that the methodology remains relevant and effective in delivering successful project outcomes.
By incorporating tailoring, PRINCE2 provides a framework that can be customized to meet the unique management needs of any organization, making it a versatile and widely applicable project management methodology.

questions.question_text: What is an advantage of applying the 'manage by stages' principle?

choices.A: The PRINCE2 method can be used for any type of project
choices.D: Tolerances can be defined for delegated authority
choices.C: The project has decision points so that it does not run on in an uncontrolled manner
choices.B: The project delivers benefits that are aligned with strategic objectives

discussion.content:
A; Why the other options are less suitable:

B. Directing a project: This process is about the project board's overall guidance and authorization, not the detailed monitoring of work packages.   
C. Managing a stage boundary: This process focuses on the transition between stages, not the day-to-day monitoring within a stage.
D. Managing product delivery: This process is about accepting completed products from teams, not the ongoing monitoring of their work.

In PRINCE2, the process where the project manager monitors the work assigned to a team manager is called "Managing a Stage Boundary". This process is part of the "Controlling a Stage" process, which is one of the seven processes in the PRINCE2 framework.

The Project Manager does the directing, not the Team Manager which is responsible for product delivery only.

questions.question_text: In which process does the project manager monitor the work assigned to a team manager?
Which is a responsibility of the project board?

choices.B: To ensure production of the project's outputs
choices.C: To ensure effective communication with external stakeholders
choices.D: To implement the change control approach
choices.A: To manage the team managers and project support

discussion.content:
The correct answer is C. To ensure effective communication with external stakeholders.

Here's why:

Stakeholder Engagement: The project board is responsible for representing the interests of all key stakeholders, both internal and external to the project. This includes ensuring effective communication with those stakeholders to:
Keep them informed about the project's progress.   
Manage their expectations.   
Address their concerns.
Gain their support.

questions.question_text: Which is a purpose of the Controlling a Stage process?

choices.C: Enable the Project Board to be provided with sufficient information to authorize the next stage
choices.B: Provide a fixed reference point at which acceptance for the project product is confirmed
choices.D: Enable the organization to understand the work that needs to be done to deliver the project's products
choices.A: Assign work to be done and take corrective action to ensure that the stage remains within tolerance

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
"The purpose of the Controlling a Stage process is to assign
